citeinfo.title: BFA_Sites
citeinfo.origin: NC DENR, Division of Waste Management, Brownfields Program

pubinfo.publish: North Carolina Division of Waste Management Brownfields Program

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

descript.abstract: This data set represents the location of sites with a completed Brownfields Agreement as recorded in the NC DENR Division of Waste Management Brownfields Program database. The Program is authorized by the state statute Brownfields Property Reuse Act. For more information, visit http://www.ncbrownfields.org
descript.purpose: The purpose of this data set is to provide a geographic representation of the location of sites with completed and eligible Brownfields Agreements under the Brownfields Property Reuse Act. This dataset is intended for general planning and mapping purposes (rather than highly accurate analytical or public health purposes).
descript.supplinf: Completed Brownfields Agreement site locations are derived from county parcel GIS data. The lat/long coordinates are generated from the centriod of the parcel(s) that make up the Brownfields Agreement Sites. Where the centriod is not located within a property (parcel) boundary, the location is moved to be within the nearest parcel. Parcels that represent multiple Brownfield Agreements contain multiple points, the generation of which are not necessarily the centriod of the parcel(s) polygon. All sites fall within the boundaries of a single parcel associated with the Brownfields Agreement land restriction. Consistent horizontal positional accuracy for this dataste varies across the state and is not quantifiable because the data was compiled from a variety of sources. The attribute source data is natively housed in a non-spatial relational database, rather than a GIS system.

theme.themekey: North Carolina Department of Environment and Natural Resources

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currentness and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the Division of Waste Management would be appreciated.

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.5.4400

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

enttyp.enttypd: Point-location depicting Completed Brownfield Agreement sites (projects)

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Location of project site by city; the project may not necessarily be within the city limits
Location of project site by county (landuse restrictions are recorded in the County Register of Deeds offices; some sites may be located and recorded in multiple counties)
Unique identifier for each Brownfield Agreement project
Official recorded acreage of the landuse restriction area under the Brownfields Agreement
Contact (project manager) for a Brownfields Program project
Hyperlink that points to the BF LURU forms on the WM website

overview.eaover: This published GIS dataset contains a selection of publicly useful and approved attributes extracted from the Brownfields Program database such as Brownfield project name, city, county, identifier, date of recordation, acreage and project manager (contact).

dataqual.complete: All sites in the Brownfields Program with completed Brownfield Agreements are present as of the date of currentness; sites eligible for Brownfields Agreements and those with pending eligibility are not included.
dataqual.logic: Locations of Brownfield sites fall within the parcel boundaries as delineated from county parcel plats and plat information matches that within the Brownfields Agreement.

procstep.procdesc: Generated an Excel list of completed Brownfield agreement sites starting from the date of the last BF site from previous Brownfields GIS layer to December 31, 2012. The list contains records with all pertinent information (Site Number, Site Name, Site County, etc….) to be included as attributes in final layers, along with the current street address.

The Excel sheet is added to the GIS data frame for Geocoding. All sites in list are shown on map by geocoded address derived from the NCDOT ISRN_Nov2007 statewide data layer [found here - https://connect.ncdot.gov/resources/gis/Pages/GIS-Data-Layers.aspx Look under "Other data" heading on that web page]
The parcel(s) are identified by using the recorded BF plat and then selected from "AgParcels2010" layer - [\\10.251.170.130\wmGIS\DWM ArcUsers\GIS Data (read only)\State\AgParcels2010\CP2010.gdb]
After parcel selections are made, the data is exported as a layer file. BF project numbers are added to the records for merging BF data and dissolving the parcels into one polygon/site.

An additional check on the BF perimeter is performed against the BF plat. Any needed changes to the polygons are performed at this time by using the plat meets & bounds. The new BFBoundary Layer (polygon) is created.
A geocentroid is created base on the new polygons and pertinent BF data is merged to create the new BFSites layer (point).
Final layers are created by combining previous BF layers with the new BF layers.
GIS Layer Updated; new field [BF_LURU_Fo] added
GIS layer updated; Metadata updated; data published
GIS layer updated; Metadata updated; data published

distinfo.distliab: NC DENR staff have compiled this dataset to the best of their abilities using the resources available, and neither verifies nor guarantees the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of any data provided. NC DENR provides this data without warranty of any kind whatsoever, either express or implied, and shall not be liable for incidental, consequential, or special damages arising out of its use.
